DOC.HEADLINE: WORLD IN BRIEF ; IRAQ ; AIR COVER RESUMES IN ' NO FLY ' ZONE
DOC.TEXT: U.S. and allied jet fighters resumed patrols over northern Iraq after a one-day halt in the wake of Thursday ' s downing of two American helicopters by U.S. warplanes , the Pentagon said . The U.S. European Command ordered the protective flights resumed on a reduced schedule over a " no fly " zone north of the 36th Parallel . The zone was imposed after the 1991 Persian_Gulf_War by the allies to protect Kurds in northern Iraq .
